title: the word Fa%%ot must now be an insta 14 day suspension.
body:
just by looking at the titles of 4 day suspensions and my own the only thing in common that I can see is the use of the "%%%got".

is it a homophobe to use? no. can it mean a bundle of sticks? yes. should riot grow up a little? yes. am I now pissed off that the word %%%got must be an insta ban? hell fucking yes!

replies.body:
Yep any of the no-no words on Riot's end are instant 14 day bans, also i'm fairly certain that chat restrictions no longer exist.

EDIT: and the funny thing is, the people that deserve the instant escalations, get away with their behaviour.

Whereas people that at best deserve chat restrictions are banned in the dozen for uses of one no-no word.

don't get me wrong, in this day and age that word shouldn't be used and fair enough but a chat restriction for first time offenders should be issued not given a 14 day suspension only because the next penalty is a perma ban. 
and also if they want to get technical, a %%%got is also a definition of a bundle of sticks so get the bans right.
sick of being told I'm boosted or trash or get cancer and what ever then I say something as small as this and I'm fucked right after it and that toxic fuck wit of a person is still playing the game feeding his ass off

Nobody is using it in the context of a pile of sticks, so stop trying that one on.

It's being used in reference to homosexuality and in a negative, derogatory way.

Maybe instead of telling Riot to grow up, you could try not acting like a whiny little child and have the maturity to not use the word.
how about you stop telling people what they mean like your some sort of king shit and go write a formal written complaint to someone that cares about your opinion

If you want someone to respect your opinion, respecting theirs is a good first step. Language like this is about intent, majority intent, and audience reception. If you want to use words like that as jokes between friends that's fine, but if you bring it onto a public forum then you willingly open yourself up to the consequences.

If you've ever used it in relation to a bundle of sticks then congratulations to you, but if you're such a wordsmith then I'm sure you understand that when words have multiple meanings people assume the one more commonly used unless the context explicitly indicates otherwise. It is a word grounded in negative connotations, so that is how people will take it.

Remember that the rating for this game is 13+ and I'm sure there are a decent chunk of younger players than that. If you wish to refer to a bundle of sticks, then why not use those words instead, and if you want to call someone an idiot, well then maybe just calling them an idiot will get you a lesser punishment that a homophobic slur so you should probably give it a go. Baby steps right?

I mean again to be fair, an instant escalation for one use of a word, is too much.

When people can freely get away with multiple racist comments day in day out, you can't fucking escalate shit like this.
I wasn't and won't comment on the instant escalation, I was commenting on his opinion of the appropriateness of the word.

Chat is a valuable tool. It can be home to toxicity yes, but it has it's uses, especially in ranked. Every online community is plagued with toxicity, competitive based games more so than others. It's not a problem you can just erase.

It hasn't meant a bundle of sticks in a long time. If you wish to use it that way in a place where everyone will assume you mean it the other, then go ahead, but you will face the consequences of doing so. I don't think anyone is going to lose sleep over someone else being banned for using a slur.
